definitions.definition: Something that is or has been assimilated.
To incorporate nutrients into the body, especially after digestion.
definitions.example: Food is assimilated and converted into organic tissue.

definitions.definition: To incorporate or absorb (knowledge) into the mind.
definitions.example: The teacher paused in her lecture to allow the students to assimilate what she had said.

definitions.definition: To absorb (a person or people) into a community or culture.
definitions.example: The aliens in the science-fiction film wanted to assimilate human beings into their own race.

definitions.definition: To bring to a likeness or to conformity; to cause a resemblance between.
To be incorporated or absorbed into something.
